1.name: Wise Girls
1.description: The father of three grown daughters tries to keep his sanity, even after his free-spirited middle daughter rebelliously marries a poor plumber.

2.name: Pandora's Box
2.description: The rise and inevitable fall of an amoral but naive young woman whose insouciant eroticism inspires lust and violence in those around her.

3.name: The Broadway Melody
3.description: A pair of sisters from the vaudeville circuit try to make it big time on Broadway, but matters of the heart complicate the attempt.

4.name: Blackmail
4.description: After killing a man in self-defense, a young woman is blackmailed by a witness to the killing.

5.name: The Cocoanuts
5.description: During the Florida land boom, The Marx Brothers run a hotel, auction off some land, thwart a jewel robbery, and generally act like themselves.

6.name: The Single Standard
6.description: The wealthy Arden Stuart is bored in a party; after refusing the wedding proposal of Tommy Hewlett, she drives her car with her driver to a lonely place. She has one night stand with him ...                See full summary »

7.name: Wild Orchids
7.description: A prince in Java tries to seduce his visitor's wife, but he's discovered.

8.name: Coquette
8.description: A flirtatious Southern belle is compromised with one of her suitors.

9.name: The Kiss
9.description: An unhappily married woman is caught up in scandal and murder when her affection toward a young man is misinterpreted.

10.name: The Canary Murder Case
10.description: A beautiful showgirl, nicknamed 'the Canary', is a scheming nightclub singer. Blackmailing is her game and soon ends up dead. But who killed 'the Canary'. All the suspects who knew her had ...                See full summary »

11.name: Diary of a Lost Girl
11.description: After falling pregnant to a pharmacist and refusing to marry, a young woman is thrown from her home and sent to a scrict girls' reform school.

12.name: Woman in the Moon
12.description: A tenacious scientist blasts off for the moon in hopes of riches that may be found there.

13.name: The Love Parade
13.description: The queen of mythical Sylvania marries a courtier, who finds his new life unsatisfying.

14.name: Piccadilly
14.description: A young Chinese woman, working in the kitchen at a London dance club, is given the chance to become the club's main act which soon leads to a plot of betrayal, forbidden love and murder.

15.name: The Wolf of Wall Street
15.description: A ruthless stockbroker sells short in the copper business and ruins the life of his friends by ruining their finances.

16.name: The Wild Party
16.description: Wild girls at a college pay more attention to parties than their classes. But when one party girl, Stella Ames, goes too far at a local bar and gets in trouble, her professor has to rescue ...                See full summary »

17.name: Hallelujah
17.description: In a juke joint, sharecropper Zeke falls for a beautiful dancer, Chick, but she's only setting him up for a rigged craps game. He loses $100, the money he got for the sale of his family's ...                See full summary »

18.name: The Hollywood Revue of 1929
18.description: An all-star revue featuring MGM contract players.

19.name: The Mysterious Island
19.description: On a volcanic island near the kingdom of Hetvia rules Count Dakkar, a benevolent leader and scientist who has eliminated class distinction among the island's inhabitants. Dakkar, his ...                See full summary »

20.name: The Virginian
20.description: A good-natured cowboy who is romancing the new schoolmarm has a crisis of conscience when he discovers his best friend is engaged in cattle rustling.

21.name: The Greene Murder Case
21.description: At the end of each year, the extremely wealthy but odious Greene family gets together at the spooky old family castle to establish terms of a will, though they despise each other. This year...                See full summary »

22.name: The Taming of the Shrew
22.description: In sixteenth century Padua, Hortensio loves Bianca, the youngest daughter of Baptista. But Baptista will not allow the two to get married until his eldest daughter, the extremely headstrong...                See full summary »

23.name: White Hell of Pitz Palu
23.description: A man climbs a 12,000-foot mountain to search for his wife, who was lost on their honeymoon. Another couple makes the dangerous climb with him.

24.name: The Trespasser
24.description: The trial and tribulations of a strong-willed woman who elopes and gives birth out of wedlock without telling her ex-husband.

25.name: Where East Is East
25.description: When an animal trapper in Indo-China finds that his daughter's fiancé is being successfully seduced by her estranged mother, he takes appropriate action.

26.name: On with the Show!
26.description: A musical advertised as the first 100% natural color, all-singing production. The plot concerns a wide-eyed former hatcheck girl who takes the place of a rebellious star.

27.name: Glorifying the American Girl
27.description: The rise of a showgirl, Gloria Hughes, culminating in a Ziegfeld extravaganza "Glorifying the American Girl".

28.name: The Manxman
28.description: A fisherman and a rising young lawyer, who grew up as brothers, fall in love with the same girl.

29.name: Words and Music
29.description: Phil and Pete compete for Mary's love and also in a contest for best song written by a college student.

30.name: Alibi
30.description: Chick Williams, a prohibition gangster, rejoins his mob soon after being released from prison. When a policeman is murdered during a robbery, he falls under suspicion. The gangster took ...                See full summary »

31.name: The Black Watch
31.description: Captain Donald King of the British Army goes to India just as World War I breaks out, convincing his comrades that he is a coward. In reality, he is on a secret mission to rescue British ...                See full summary »

32.name: Show Boat
32.description: A mostly silent version of Edna Ferber's original novel, with some songs from the musical as a last-minute addition

33.name: Bulldog Drummond
33.description: A bored WWI veteran helps out a young woman, whose uncle is being held hostage by embezzlers.

34.name: The Four Feathers
34.description: When British officer Harry resigns from his regiment, he is labeled a coward by his family and friends. Harry receives four white feathers as a mark of a coward. In order to redeem himself ...                See full summary »

35.name: The Divine Lady
35.description: The story of the romance between Emma, Lady Hamilton, and British war hero Admiral Horatio Nelson.

36.name: Sally
36.description: Sally was an orphan who got her name from the telephone exchange where she was abandoned as a baby. In the orphanage, she discovered the joy of dancing and has been practicing since. ...                See full summary »

37.name: Disraeli
37.description: Prime Minister of Great Britain Benjamin Disraeli outwits the subterfuge of the Russians and chicanery at home in order to secure the purchase of the Suez Canal.

38.name: Welcome Danger
38.description: Harold Bledsoe, a botany student, is called back home to San Francisco, where his late father had been police chief, to help investigate a crime wave in Chinatown.

39.name: The Locked Door
39.description: On her first anniversary Ann Reagan finds that her sister-in-law is involved with a shady character from her own past, and determines to intervene.

40.name: Rio Rita
40.description: Capt. James Stewart pursues the bandit "The Kinkajou" over the Mexican border and falls in love with Rita. He suspects, that her brother is the bandit.

41.name: Sunnyside Up
41.description: Molly and Bee, sweet young 'working girls,' live in a cheap room over a New York grocery store. Molly's idol, wealthy Jack Cromwell, lives in a Long Island mansion but is markedly less ...                See full summary »

42.name: The Great Gabbo
42.description: An insanely, egocentric ventriloquist, even though he is possessed by his wooden dummy, is in love with a dancer who is in love with another. The dummy gives advice to the ventriloquist.

43.name: Show of Shows
43.description: It's 1929. The studio gave the cinema its voice gave offered the audiences a chance to see their favorite actors and actresses from the silent screen era to see and for the first time can ...                See full summary »

44.name: Weary River
44.description: A gangster is put in prison, but finds salvation through music while serving his time. Again on the outside, he finds success elusive and temptations abound.

45.name: The Letter
45.description: Jeanne Eagels plays the bored and restless Leslie Crosbie who turns to another man, Geoffrey Hammond (Herbert Marshall) for attention when neglected by her husband Robert (Reginald Owen). ...                See full summary »

46.name: Lucky Star
46.description: Mary, a poor farm girl, meets Tim just as word comes that war has been declared. Tim enlists in the army and goes to the battlefields of Europe, where he is wounded and loses the use of his...                See full summary »

47.name: The Saturday Night Kid
47.description: Mayme and sister Janie are salesgirls in Ginsberg's Department Store. Mayme is in love with store clerk Bill, but Janie tries to steal him from her. Hazel, another salesgirl, is Jean Harlow's first credited role.

49.name: Spite Marriage
49.description: An unimpressive but well intending man is given the chance to marry a popular actress, of whom he has been a hopeless fan. But what he doesn't realize is that he is being used to make the actress' old flame jealous.

50.name: Salute
50.description: West Point Cadet John and Annapolis Midshipman Frank focus their fraternal rivalry on the big Army-Navy football game.
